item.title: Traffic light missing, 2nd October
item.description:
Traffic light is missing on the junction of queens road and Christchurch road. People are therefore driving through red lights.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Penfold, 24 Queen's Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Broken lid on dog waste bin at The Avenue, 2nd October
item.description:
Dog waste bin lid has broken and is in a dangerous condition. There are sharp, jagged rusty metal edges which are causing a high risk of injury to users. This bin is located on The Avenue, Churchdown near to the junction with Station Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 The Avenue, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Objects in River Chelt, 30th September
item.description:

item.title: Overgrown bush blocking view out of junction, 29th September
item.description:
Difficult to see out of the junction from Hartley Lane onto Leckhampton Hill Road. This has the potential to cause a nasty accident as you have to edge out into the main road to be able to view up the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Firsbrake Hartley Lane, Leckhampton Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Harsh Speedhumps, Potholes and Poor repairs, 29th September
item.description:
The road is in a massive state. The speed humps are too aggressive and like driving over curbs. I understand the need but I think that islands would be better suited. Travelling along this road every day is causing excessive wear to the cars suspension. If its not the speed humps causing damage its the potholes or poor workmanship repairing them. This has been an ongoing problem for many many months now!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 101 Caernarvon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 Vans Parking Outside our House stopping Us being able to park outside our home, 29th September
item.description:
Itâ€™s Been Happening For About 5 Months There Blocking the view of the round and parking on The corner Which Is Dangerous For Everyone Who Uses The Road, We Also Find Ourselves And Our Neighbours Canâ€™t Park Outside Our House Because They Take Up So Much Space And They Dont Live On Our Road, when Asking Them To Park Else Where Theyve Been Rude
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 55 Thompson Way, Innsworth

item.title: Dumped empty beer bottles/ cans, 29th September
item.description:
By the rock area, and seated area before you exit Symphony Road via the footpath there are broken beer bottles, cans and rubbish dumped. Itâ€™s getting really tiresome in the area for cannabis smoking, drinking in the day, graffiti and now they appear to be dumping and leaving their glass bottles. Small children play and explore in this area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): South Grove Cold Pool Lane, Up Hatherley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches and leaves, 29th September
item.description:
